listing.name: Luxury apartment at Amstel river

user.about:
I'm married and have two children. When we go on holidays we use airbnb also to discover great places. We always have warm connections with great people, that's what we love about it!

The apartment is great because of the view on the Amstel river. It's surroundings are quiet, but you are very close to the city center. This is unique for Amsterdam!

listing.description:
Apartment along the Amstel river with great view. Includes: two bedrooms with double beds; luxurious bathroom with rain shower; separate toilet. Equipped kitchen with espresso maker and nicely furnished. Quiet surroundings, unique for Amsterdam.

- Large living area: large 6 person sofa, flatscreen, playstation 3, books and dvd's, 3 person desk for laptops/working.
- Kitchen with bar, coffee/espresso maker, dish washer, cooking equipment.
- Master bedroom with kingsize bed. Second bedroom with double bed and third bunk bed.
- Bathroom with rain shower and double washbasins.
- Separate toilet.
- Storage area.
- Parking place in below garage with optional keycard.
- Elevator to 4th floor.

The entire apartment is available.

We are more than helpful in showing you which places to go to, you can text us and we'll provide you with tips.

Great quiet location because it's so close to the lively neighbourhoods de Pijp, East, Rivierenbuurt. Take a 30 minute walk to the city center, or maybe rent a bike or take the tram and you'll be there in 10 minutes. Restaurants around the corner include Riva on the Amstel and Dauphine with a jazz club on most Fridays. For late night shopping the Amstel station includes just about anything: supermarket, bookshop, pharmacy, food like Burger King, pasta or falafel.

Next to Amstel station (with train, metro, tram, bus, taxi, bike rental), 5 minutes to Central Station, 20 minutes to Schiphol Airport. Parking place available using keycard on request. I can make a taxi reservation for you from Schiphol airport at half the regular prices.

The apartment is great because of the view on the Amstel river. It's surroundings are quiet, but you are very close to the city center. This is unique for Amsterdam!
listing.house_rules:
- Smoking inside the house is not allowed.
- Parties are not allowed, this is checked by the security. 
- Pets are allowed on special request, with extra cleaning costs.
- Remind keeping noise down. After 10pm no noise permitted.
- Damages to the house/interior will be charged to the guests.
- Please no food or eating in the bed/bedrooms. Although we clean, the next guest will be thankful.
listing.instant_book_welcome_message: You are welcome to visit Amsterdam. Can you tell me a bit more about your guests/family so I can make your stay as great as possible? What time will you arrive and do you already have a flight number?
listing.interaction: We are more than helpful in showing you which places to go to, you can text us and we'll provide you with tips.

Take a 30 minute walk to the city center, or maybe rent a bike or take the tram and you'll be there in 10 minutes. Restaurants around the corner include Riva on the Amstel and Dauphine with a jazz club on most Fridays. For late night shopping the Amstel station includes just about anything: supermarket, bookshop, pharmacy, food like Burger King, pasta or falafel.

review.comments:
Paul's Amstel home was very convenient as it was very near the Amstel station. The apartment is very spacious and perfect for my family of five. The location was just right as it was away from the hustle and bustle of city central but near enough for a short commute. 

The only letdown about Paul's place was it was not properly cleaned when we got there, and it is poorly maintained. There was only one garbage can in the entire apartment which was filled with garbage. There were soiled towels still hanging by the towel hooks in the bathroom. The floor wiper was left in the shower area. Worst of all, the toilet seat was not cleaned (it had a small spot on the seat) and there was no toilet paper! There was even a pair of socks left on the ledge behind the toilet. The apartment also smelled like it had been occupied by smokers. The couch was also quite dirty and badly needs to be shampooed. The masters bedroom had very bad lighting with a damaged light fixture in the middle of the room, and no evening lamps on the night tables beside the bed contrary to what you see on the picture.

If Paul were paying for a cleaning service to clean the apartment, I would strongly recommend replacing that cleaning service. I would have also held off paying the cleaning fee since it was not cleaned well.

All in all, I would hesitate to stay at Paul's apartment again primarily because it is not well maintained.
